title: How do I move on?
author: speaker
text: I'm obsessing about a terrible breakup. Everything is a constant reminder. How do I move on?

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Dealing with a breakup is difficult.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: We have high hopes and then those hopes and dreams are dashed and we feel at a loss for how to deal with this sudden change in our lives.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: First, it is important to acknowledge that losing a relationship is a loss and we need to grieve that loss.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: If we don't allow ourselves time to process and move through the grieving process, we may remain stuck and it may make it hard to move on.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: So in some ways, you don't want to move on too soon by just trying to ignore your feelings.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Instead, take good care of yourself, talk to friends and give your self time to heal.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: The second most important thing is to forgive yourself; this is also an important part of taking care of yourself.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: You might be blaming yourself and re-living moments when you wish you would have done things differently.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: By replaying those thoughts you remain stuck.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: When we begin to forgive ourselves, we truly begin to heal.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Lastly, in my experience the people who have the most difficulty moving on have not really severed all ties with their ex.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: They are still following them on social media or even checking in with texts.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: This is probably the hardest part for some people, but to move forward there needs to be a clear boundary and a clear ending.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: If you have a clear ending, you can have a new beginning.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: I hope this helps.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Take good care of yourself!

title: How do I move on?
author: speaker
text: I'm obsessing about a terrible breakup. Everything is a constant reminder. How do I move on?

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Relationships can be extremely enjoyable and satisfying.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: When relationships end, however, it can be devastating.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: It is normal to go through a grieving process after a breakup.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Denial, bargaining, sadness, anger and eventually acceptance are all normal stages of grief.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: You may experience these feelings all at once or one at a time.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Allow yourself time to grieve by expressing your emotions - talk to a friend or write in a journal.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Take care of yourself during this time by exercising, eating and sleeping well and spending time with friends.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: After some time you should start feeling better.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: If you feel like you're not feeling better and you don't know what to do, you can see a therapist to help you get through this difficult time.

title: How do I move on?
author: speaker
text: I'm obsessing about a terrible breakup. Everything is a constant reminder. How do I move on?

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Breaking up can be a very difficult thing.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: I'm sorry you're feeling badly.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: The first thing is to be really sure you are taking care of yourself --- that means eating well, exercising, getting good sleep, spending time with friends/family and making sure you are taking care of important things like work, rent, bills etc.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Secondly, it's important to do things that make you feel better and not worse.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: If looking up your ex on social media makes you feel worse stop doing it!

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: It's important to concentrate on you and not them.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Thirdly, it's super important to make sure you're really looking at the situation accurately and look for the good things that still exist in your life ---  what is still good?

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Even though your emotions are hurting and you are feeling badly, can you see the light at the end of the tunnel?

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Do you feel hope?

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: If you do try to concentrate on that hope feeling.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: If the obsessing continues and really gets in the way of living your life?

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Maybe contact a therapist or counsellor that can help you through this difficult time?

title: How do I move on?
author: speaker
text: I'm obsessing about a terrible breakup. Everything is a constant reminder. How do I move on?

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Hi, Break ups can be very devastating and even traumatic.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Recovering from one is a process that is unique for everyone person and will take time.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: It's important that you don't compare yourself to others.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Each and every person will experience this grieving process differently.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Here are a few tips to help with your recovery: 1.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Make sure you surround yourself with people who love you and support you, friends and family.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Even though you might feel like being alone, make an effort to be around them.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Although you might not feel like it, try to take care of yourself as much as possible: eat healthily, get regular sleep, & vigorous or gentle exercise (depending on your mood).

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: The last thing that we want to do when we are physically sick (e.g.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: flu) is to take care of ourselves even thought that's what we need the most.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: But when we do get that chicken broth, sleep and vitamins we recover much faster and with less discomfort.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: That's exactly the same when it comes to emotional pain.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Take care of yourself, keep yourself strong and healthy so you can recover faster.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: As much as possible, put away reminders of the relationship.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: You might not be ready to throw things out, but try to put them away in a box in the storage or in a closet.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: And also block Social Media reminders.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: There is a lot of wisdom in the saying "Out of Sight, Out of Mind."

title: How do I move on?
author: listener

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Once the initial shock and intensity of the break up wear off, try out something new.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: In a relationship, we often forget and give up on things that we always wanted to do or to try.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Now it's time to bring out that dusty bucket list and start trying something new.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: If possible, change your scenery by going away on vacation with a friend or even by yourself.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Changing your surroundings can really help you change your thoughts, mindset and forget your ex even if just for a few hours.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: Even a weekend getaway with a couple of girlfriends can do wonders.

title: How do I move on?
author: listener

title: How do I move on?
author: listener
text: In addition, to help you make sense of your past relationship and what went wrong, I would highly recommend seeing a professional counsellor or therapist.

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: speaker
text: I recently went through a divorce. My ex-husband called my sister saying bad things about me. My sister never defended me. Now that I showed the truth, she's shutting me up and saying she doesn't care about the fight. Why didn't she convey that to him from the beginning?

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: listener
text: Sorry for so much emotional pain from the combination of the divorce and your sister not supporting you in the way you wish.When you feel ready and if you feel this would help, then consider to talk to your sister from perspective to improve the relationship the two of you have.Since the ex is gone and the sister is an ongoing person in your life, this particular incident is only one in many which the two of you will have with each other.The disappointment you feel now as to how she handled herself, is a point to bring up to her for the sake of clarifying the type of relationship you each would like to build with each other.As to your specific question as to why she did what she did, she is the only person who has the answer.Start with finding out if she wants to improve the relationship altogether.

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: listener
text: Then you can use her lack of support with the ex, as an example of how meaningful her support of you is to you.

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: speaker
text: I recently went through a divorce. My ex-husband called my sister saying bad things about me. My sister never defended me. Now that I showed the truth, she's shutting me up and saying she doesn't care about the fight. Why didn't she convey that to him from the beginning?

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: listener
text: Unfortunately, I can't tell you what your sister was feeling or why she reacted that way.I can say that divorces can be difficult or confusing for everyone involved.

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: listener
text: While the divorce is most impactful for the couple going through it, the divorce itself also changes extended family dynamics.

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: listener
text: Also, a lot of people don't act the same way around extended family (or other people) as they do at home behind closed doors, so there are times when divorce is a real shock to everyone who was not directly involved in it.I wonder if you are at a place where you can shift your focus into looking at your relationship with your sister, how she is treating you, how you feel around her now, etc.

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: listener
text: I do not know how close you were before all of this and how close you feel now, but perhaps if you can assess your overall relationship, you could find a time when you could ask about this (why she didn't convey that to him from the beginning) in a way that is calm, not defensive, and is honestly looking for an answer from your sister, not looking to defend yourself at that moment.

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: listener
text: If that conversation can happen, it may be quite a difficult one, so it may be good to have something to think of to remind yourself that you are trying to gather information from her and him that conversation, it's not about you, but is about where she was coming from.

title: Why did my sister not defend me when my ex-husband said bad things about me?
author: listener
text: After you think you understand that (I'm saying that you understand where she's coming from, not that you agree with what she's saying), you could see if she's willing to listen to how you feel about it.

title: How can I get my ex-girlfriend back?
author: speaker
text: She said she needed space after three days of dating, and she got a boyfriend a week later. I still really miss her, and she told me she still likes me.

title: How can I get my ex-girlfriend back?
author: listener
text: It sounds as if your ex-girlfriend is trying to figure out what type of relationship she is looking to have with you.

title: How can I get my ex-girlfriend back?
author: listener
text: There are lots of levels of relationships, from a basic acquaintance, to a more friendly acquaintance, to a friend, close friend, best friend, early romantic partner, committed romantic partner, and many more.If she is willing to have a conversation with you about her feelings, it may be helpful to have her explain her feelings to you while listening as an investigative reporter and asking questions that cannot be answered with yes or no, but are what are called open-ended questions, which ask her to provide more information.

title: How can I get my ex-girlfriend back?
author: listener
text: During this process, it would be helpful for you to try to think of it as not being personal, but just listening and trying to understand the experience from her perspective.

title: How can I get my ex-girlfriend back?
author: listener
text: After you have done this for five minutes (it's a rough estimate, but basically until you can restate what she is saying and she says you have it right), you can switch so she is asking you questions about how you are feeling.

title: How can I get my ex-girlfriend back?
author: listener
text: The goal is not necessarily to change the outcome, but to learn more about yourselves and each other.Then you may have an idea of where you stand in each other's eyes.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: speaker
text: My fiancé and I broke up. He cheated on me numerous times. I kept forgiving but questioning his every move. He got tired and left.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: listener
text: Cheating on you shows a lack of commitment, in addition to the emotional hurt it creates.Probably you didn't actually forgive him because if you did, then you wouldn't have been asking questions of his every move.Maybe you were open to forgiving him.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: listener
text: In order for forgiveness to be effective, the person who has done the injuring must first show some understanding and empathy for the great pain the person caused in you.From what you write, your fiancé didn't seem to have much interest in earning back your trust or in empathizing with the way his cheating effected you.It is very likely his tiredness is also tiredness you feel, of having to watch him all the time.As uncomfortable as adjusting with the disappointment of him leaving you, the situation you describe sounds like it was unsatisfying for both of you.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: speaker
text: My fiancé and I broke up. He cheated on me numerous times. I kept forgiving but questioning his every move. He got tired and left.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: listener
text: There is a grieving process after losing a relationship (or any other major loss, such as a job, a house, etc.).

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: listener
text: One of the things to consider is give yourself a chance to go through the tasks of mourning:To accept the reality of the lossTo process the pain of griefTo adjust to a world without the person who has just leftTo find an enduring connection with that person in the midst of embarking on a new life.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: listener
text: This could mean a lot of things, but it could be holding certain memories as your own.You may also find things that make you feel happy or comfortable.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: listener
text: It's also helpful to have people who you can talk to about your feelings and people who may be able to recognize things about you that you cannot see right now (such as how you are honest, committed to your work, a good listener, etc.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: listener
text: ).This takes some time.

title: How can I deal with a break up?
author: listener
text: Try to be gentle with yourself.

title: How can I find out I'm being cheated on?
author: speaker
text: I was in a relationship with a woman for four years. We both made mistakes, but I do love her.    She has moved in with another lady. I think she is just cheating on me to make me miss her. How can I find out for sure?

title: How can I find out I'm being cheated on?
author: listener
text: Has your former partner made any efforts to be in contact with you in order to restart your relationship?From what you describe, your former partner is in a new relationship.It is possible that since you love her and would like to be together again, that you are misinterpreting your former partner's actions.If you'd like to have more certainty as to wether your former partner is cheating or whether she is happy to be with the new partner, is to contact her and ask her your question.A better road may be to accept your sad feelings that she is with someone else.Since she was meaningful to you, respect the sadness you feel and that the relationship didn't continue as you wished.

title: My husband kept a huge secret from me
author: speaker
text: He had a sexual relationship with his sister and kept it from me for years, I confronted about it and he finally told me what happened. But I dont think he is telling me the whole story. He works with her and sees her every day.    I feel that I shouldn't stay with him , but he says he ended it long time ago. Should I trust my husband and stay with him?

title: My husband kept a huge secret from me
author: listener
text: Trust is a necessary factor for an intimate relationship to feel safe.The person who must repair the trust is the one who has broken this trust.The best way to find out if your husband wants to restore your trust in him, is to ask him this question.

title: My husband kept a huge secret from me
author: listener
text: He may not be willing to meet your request.If he hesitates or becomes defensive about the need to restore your trust, then ask him to think his decision through and tell him the serious consequence you are considering.Ask him to reflect for a few days or a week and then to address the topic again.If you and he consistently find that he is unwilling to do anything at all to regain your trust, then I agree you have serious thinking to do as to whether or not you'd be able to live within a partnership based upon trust, in which you don't trust your partner.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: speaker
text: My ex-fiancé (whom I am still seeing) left me because of the pressure from all three of his teenage daughters. They wanted him to try to work it out with their mom (his ex-girlfriend of 20 years). He and I split three months ago, but I have been seeing him pretty regularly despite the fact that he is living back with his ex-girlfriend and kids. He is "co-existing" for the kids and fighting all the time with his ex-girlfriend. His daughters don’t want their dad with me because my two boys (grown adults and on their own now) had bad reputations and issues with drugs. His daughters say it is embarrassing for him to be with me. He and I had an absolutely amazing relationship and connect on so many levels. He is getting a lot of pressure from his family and his longtime friends to "do the right thing" and stay with his ex-girlfriend for the kids. He says he wants me to wait. We were going get married last year. He bought me a $1000 dress, we had invitations made, and everything set up, but then his girls told him they'd never speak to him again if he married me. He says he’s trying to mend his relationship with them.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Hello.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: It seems you are in a set of circumstances that are highly uncomfortable for you.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Do you feel those circumstances are healthy?

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Do you find pleasure being in such a place of uncertainty?

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Why do you continue to be in this situation?

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Without meaning to appear that I might be lacking in compassion, you do have the option to leave the connection completely if the harm it is doing is more that the pleasure it brings you.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Is there a benefit to being in this relationship?

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Do you consider this situation to be for your highest good?

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Is it healthy to be involved in something that is not likely healthy or perhaps could even be seen as dysfunctional?

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: In truth, only you can decide the answers to these very important questions.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: I would encourage you to think of who benefits by being in this situation, and how you might be able to find happiness in other relationships that are healthier and more positive.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: In my clinical view based on what I read, this particular relationship does not carry the joy I am sure you want, nor the healthy interactions you would expect in a functional romantic engagement with another person.Beating yourself up about potentially wasting all this time waiting for the other person to come around will not serve a positive purpose.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: It likely will only lower your self-esteem.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: There is a time to wait to see how things develop, and a time to move on to other experiences.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: You are the one to make that choice, but I would encourage you to connect with your inner higher self, for the most clear answer.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Chances are, you already know the answer, you just need to embrace it.

title: How long do I wait on my ex-fiancé to choose me over his ex-girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Getting in touch with a counselor in your area can also help ferret out some of the deeper issues that you might not have felt comfortable expressing here.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: speaker
text: Ive been in an on an off relationship with a this man for almost 3 years. Even though I care about him, he continues to hurt me.    He and his wife were separated when we met. Now he's going through a really difficult divorce from her and is taking it really hard. I want to end this relationship, but I don't feel like I can. How can I let go?

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: Hello, and thank you for your question.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: Boy, ending relationships is tough, isn't it?

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: Sometimes it's tough even when we are 100% sure that it is the right thing to do!I am going to give you some of my thoughts, and hopefully some colleagues will add some others.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: One of the things that I want to point out is that "letting go" is not really a thing.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: In other words, it's not really something you can reach out and grab.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: It's more of a process.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: This is good news, because you don't necessarily have to be at the end of the process to end an unhealthy relationship.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: We just have to accept that there will be feelings that come up even after the relationship is over.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: For example, someone can end an unhealthy relationship today, but then be reminded of the good times on what would have been their "anniversary."

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: This could make the person very sad.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: They may even regret ending the relationship for a little while.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: It would important, then, for the person to remind themselves why the relationship needed to end, and that they are healthier because of it.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: This is relevant for you.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: It's hard to walk away from a relationship.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: We fear all kinds of things, including being single!

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: Sometimes it's helpful to compare what you are getting out of the relationship to what you want from a relationship.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: It's helpful to be honest about what we have given up for an unhealthy relationship.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: It's fine to admit uncertainly about ending things.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: It's okay to be afraid.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: It's okay to have moments of doubt and sadness along with a dash of guilt.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: And even with all of that, someone can still leave if it is the healthiest thing for them.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: They can have sadness later on, and still not go back.It sounds like you are feeling responsible for making sure he is okay because of this divorce.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: The truth is that there is not necessarily a "perfect" time to end any relationship.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: There would be no guarantee that he would be doing any better after the divorce.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: Sometimes NOT making decisions stresses us out A LOT more than making a decision and living with the consequences, both good and bad.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: You may be at that crossroads.

title: How do I let go of someone who continues to hurt me
author: listener
text: Be well..Robin J. Landwehr, DBH, LPC, NCC

title: Why is it so hard for me to be social?
author: speaker
text: I was in a relationship for almost five years. We were friends for a few years before we got into a relationship. He was a caring, friendly, and charming guy up until three and a half years in. He started controlling me: who I hung out with, where I was at all times, and he had a huge hissy fit if I tried to ask him the same questions. All that time, he just liked me as a friend and was cheating on me with my so-called friends. At the end, he was a nasty and narcissistic person. Now it’s hard to be social.

title: Why is it so hard for me to be social?
author: listener
text: It sounds like you had a very confusing and painful experience in this relationship, and now you feel hesitant to let yourself get close to people.

title: Why is it so hard for me to be social?
author: listener
text: It is understandable that when we are hurt in relationships, we may have trouble trusting and allowing ourselves to be vulnerable with others.Therapy is a great place to explore the roots of present difficulties in relationships, to unpack what happened in prior relationships, and to find new ways to show up in relationships so that we can have the relaxed intimacy that we want.

title: Why is it so hard for me to be social?
author: listener
text: Often, relationship difficulties represent patterns of relating that we learn early in life which we may feel compelled to act on outside of our awareness and therapy provides an opportunity to become more aware of these patterns so that we can change them, enabling us to feel secure and to seek out satisfying companionship.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: speaker
text: My husband used a lot of negative words to hurt me, and I moved out. He is seeing a counselor and wants another chance to make things right. I'm not sure if I trust that he will not go back to his old ways.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: I am glad he is seeing a counselor.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: That is something that most men struggle with doing at times.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: Time will tell if his actions are of good intentions.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: However remember that a person can only do to you what you allow them to do in relationships.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: What part did you play?

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: Did you down play his disrespect at one time?

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: Did you give up the power of your own voice?

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: Did you lose yourself in the relationship and it became just one sided?

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: Did you allow him to make you doubt yourself?

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: In others words, if you do decide to give him another chance, what would you do different?

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: Not saying that you are the blame or cause of the negative words AT ALL, but don't allow such disrespect from him or anyone else in the future.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: If you do decide to give it another try, go in with a voice, with the demand of respect, with your needs and wants expressed and expected.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: With an increase in your self worth and confidence, you will know what to do if his actions are true or if with dishonest intentions.

title: I'm not sure if I want to trust my husband again
author: listener
text: Seek counseling as well, if you need that additional support to find self.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: speaker
text: My ex-boyfriend boyfriend and I lived together. He had a two year affair with a girl and had three pregnancies with her. One was an abortion, another was a miscarriage, and then she had the third baby. They are not together, but he continues to contact me and wants me back. He has nothing to offer me.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: Hi Attica,This is a question I think a lot of people deal with...they feel confusion about why they can't forget about or get over (or stop connecting with) someone who they absolutely know isn't good for them.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: In your case, part of the problem is that he keeps trying to get back in touch with you.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: For some people, honestly, it's a game... to see how much power they have over you or it's their need to control you.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: If you don't want contact from this person, it's really important to give him clear messages about boundaries ("Don't contact me again"), and then ignore all of their communications.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: Any interactions or responses from you at all will feed their behaviour.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: Remind yourself why you don't want to be with them.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: I hear you doing that already when you say "he has nothing to offer me".

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: That's great self-talk.But let's get back to the question of why we have a hard time letting go of people like this.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: Sometimes it's because we still hope they will change.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: Maybe we remember who they used to be or how they used to treat us, and we think it can go back to the way it felt in those "good old days".

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: The problem there is that, over the first few years, as intimacy grows, people tend to show more of who they are, not less.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: So what they're eventually showing you is who they are and what they're capable of.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: People do change and grow, but it won't happen at your pace.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: Accept that person for who they are and stop expecting them to change.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: Another reason we can't let go is because we picture our ex with someone new in the future and we wonder if they will be a better person for the next partner in their life.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: This is a normal... but not a healthy... thought.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: It's as though we want them to stay, maybe apologize, and heal our hurts; maybe make up for past mistakes.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: You deserve that healing, you deserve better than you got, you deserve apologies, but to expect that from the person who hurt you and hasn't demonstrated that compassion as yet is probably foolhardy.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: It is my belief that underlying some of the above scenarios is the deep belief that we must somehow be responsible for the hurts our exes have caused.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: If you blame yourself in any way for someone's poor treatment of you, you will be dancing around trying to do things differently so that they can treat you better.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: It will be impossible to let go, because you blame yourself for their behaviours.Draw a line.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: Their behaviours are about them, not you, and the only solution is to challenge and reduce thoughts of them, and create physical and emotional distance.

title: Why do I still feel a connection with my ex-boyfriend that hurt me very badly?
author: listener
text: These things plus time will help the events of the past fade from importance.

title: My husband and I are separated. I'm so scared of getting divorced
author: speaker
text: I keep on begging him to come back. I am so unhappy with him but am so scared of being a single parent to our son. I was abused as a little girl and that has made to be very abusive to men. What should I do...

title: My husband and I are separated. I'm so scared of getting divorced
author: listener
text: Major change frightens almost everybody.Don't be so afraid of your fear that you let yourself beg and are willing to accept unhappiness as a standard in your marriage.If you start considering that life can be better than what is current for you now, new possibilities and ideas will start developing in your mind.Consider finding a therapist so that you have private space to talk in detail about your fears and the new ways of seeing your Self.A therapy relationship, since it is safe and supportive, will be a good balance to having been abused, suffered, and unhappy.

title: How do I fix my marriage?
author: speaker
text: My wife just last week said she wants a divorce and it's all sudden. I understand that marriages have their ups and downs but I don't understand why she can't tell me why she wants a divorce. Should I fight for my family (daughter and wife)?

title: How do I fix my marriage?
author: listener
text: Chances are, if you really think about it, there were signs that something wasn’t quite right in your marriage.

title: How do I fix my marriage?
author: listener
text: You may have passed these things off as being the normal ups and downs of a marriage, but whatever it was (or wasn't), it's obviously bothering your wife.

title: How do I fix my marriage?
author: listener
text: I would say yes, keep trying to fight for your family, at least until you know what the problems are from your wife's perspective and if they're repairable.

title: How do I fix my marriage?
author: listener
text: Ask your wife if she’s willing to try to work on the marriage and then see a marriage counselor.

title: How do I fix my marriage?
author: listener
text: Just be sure you’re open to hearing what's said and try not to get defensive if she blames you for some things.Even if your wife is adamant about getting a divorce, that doesn't mean you’re divorcing your daughter and you should make sure she knows that.

title: How do I fix my marriage?
author: listener
text: Continue to be a part of her life.

title: How do I fix my marriage?
author: listener
text: And although it may be difficult, if a divorce does happen, try to be as amicable as possible with your wife so your daughter isn't further impacted by this new family dynamic.

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: speaker
text: I am conflicted with this guy I work with. He is a coworker and close friend whom I've had a crush on since meeting him four years ago. We made out once after years of flirting. I was hoping for more, but nothing happened. I distanced myself a lot after.

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: listener
text: Hello!

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: listener
text: Emotions run high in "crush" situations and when emotions run high it's not uncommon for us to have emotion-based instead of fact-based thoughts.

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: listener
text: After reading your question, I wondered how you went from "making out" to "nothing happened?"

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: listener
text: I wondered if this happened because of an emotion-based thought that sounded like "If he liked me, he would make something happen."

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: listener
text: A truer and more empowering thought might be "I want something different to happen with him and I want to take a different action to see if that can happen."

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: listener
text: This thought focuses more on the one thing you can control: YOU.

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: listener
text: Hopefully, the thought also empowers you to think through what you can do to gauge interest/talk with him about his feelings on the matter.

title: How do I get over a friend/coworker?
author: listener
text: I hope this helps and good luck to you!

title: A friend of my child's father is sending him inappropriate content
author: speaker
text: I believe it is wrong for men to look at inappropriate content. The father of my child has agreed to respect my beliefs. His co-worker sent him an inappropriate video. He got mad because he does not think he should tell his friend to not send him things like that.

title: A friend of my child's father is sending him inappropriate content
author: listener
text: The offspring are your Property;If you require that no other man show inappropriate content to them, then require compensation for use and enjoyment of your Property, without your consent;Send them a bill;When they do not pay it, activate the local Sheriff, take them to small claims court, and win a judgment against them for failure to compensate for the use and enjoyment of your Property;I wonder what might happen after that... learn to act as man :)... and watch the magic happen...

title: A friend of my child's father is sending him inappropriate content
author: speaker
text: I believe it is wrong for men to look at inappropriate content. The father of my child has agreed to respect my beliefs. His co-worker sent him an inappropriate video. He got mad because he does not think he should tell his friend to not send him things like that.

title: A friend of my child's father is sending him inappropriate content
author: listener
text: From what you write, it sounds like you're reaching quite far into your child's father's way to handle his friendships.There's a difference between an agreement between you and the child's father to not view porn, and with you monitoring and setting standards for your child's father's way to handle his social life.Try to accept the limits of your request extends to you and the child's father, not the way the child's father wants to handle his relationships with other people.Also, pushing too hard or setting your expectations of the child's father too wide for him to tolerate may end up backfiring on you.Who knows, maybe he'll decide "enough is enough" and withdraw from the otherwise reasonable agreement to not watch porn.

title: A friend of my child's father is sending him inappropriate content
author: speaker
text: I believe it is wrong for men to look at inappropriate content. The father of my child has agreed to respect my beliefs. His co-worker sent him an inappropriate video. He got mad because he does not think he should tell his friend to not send him things like that.

title: A friend of my child's father is sending him inappropriate content
author: listener
text: It sounds like you are wanting to protect your child from degrading images and that is one of the important parts of the job of a parent.

title: A friend of my child's father is sending him inappropriate content
author: listener
text: Although it is challenging to supply an answer without knowing the full situation, it might be helpful to have a more broad discussion about what you both think about the influences and images that your child is exposed to and what you think your role is in protecting your child.

title: A friend of my child's father is sending him inappropriate content
author: listener
text: This situation is one about beliefs and values and could well be an example you can use for exploring your parenting roles in protecting your child.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: speaker
text:
I am in a high stress position for a tech company. I am being overworked and underpaid for my contributions and it is not only giving me anxiety, but also demoralizing.
   What can I do to manage my stress?

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: It sounds like you are experiencing burnout and have very little, if no job satisfaction.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: There are some aspects of this that are in your control and others that are not.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: What type of work do you typically enjoy?

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: Do you enjoy high stress work?

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: What keeps you in this job?

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: Is there a reason you have stayed?

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: Is your boss reasonable to have a conversation with?

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: I recommend a few things.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: For one, you may want to have a discussion with your boss about your job duties and see if there is a way to either eliminate some responsibilities or get higher pay.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: Another option, if you are unable to have an open conversation, you can start to look at an ideal work situation, what would you like/ be OK with/ absolutely hate about a job.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: Then possibly try to look for a new job that fits these qualifications.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: If you are unable to leave your job, you may want to attempt to balance your work life with more activities that create joy outside of work.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: Sometimes that balance can help you tolerate work more.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: I recommend that you find a supportive person to talk with and process these frustrations as burnout can lead us to do things we may regret.

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: speaker
text:
I am in a high stress position for a tech company. I am being overworked and underpaid for my contributions and it is not only giving me anxiety, but also demoralizing.
   What can I do to manage my stress?

title: How can I cope with work related stress better?
author: listener
text: Recognize your reason for continuing to work for this place.Sometimes "overworked and underpaid" is tolerable bc of the valuable learning which the person will take with them when they've decided the time has come for these lessons to end.Or, are you in this place bc it is an easy commute to your home or fits well with other parts of your life such as education or some health related program?As long as you have a good reason to be there, you will feel there is good purpose.If there is no good purpose and every day you wake up to work for a place you can't stand, then its time to look for a new position.

title: I'm attracted to my boss
author: speaker
text: I've been suppressing it for quite some time, but there are days when I can't make eye contact with her. I think she knows, and we both admitted there was some type of vibe, but the overall discussion was vague. I think she could possibly be dating someone that works with us. It's driving me crazy. As an act of expression, I have purchased a gift for her that's personalized. I haven't given it to her yet.

title: I'm attracted to my boss
author: listener
text: Human attractions can be tricky things, and in this case - a power dynamic.

title: I'm attracted to my boss
author: listener
text: In the workplace, a boss usually has the power to hire, fire, set schedules, approve vacations, and evaluate performance.

title: I'm attracted to my boss
author: listener
text: Because of this power dynamic, most employee handbooks expressly forbid supervisors and their direct employees being in a romantic relationship.

title: I'm attracted to my boss
author: listener
text: Perhaps you should check your employee handbook.

title: I'm attracted to my boss
author: listener
text: It is possible that if you or your supervisor act on your feelings, one of you might have to be reassigned, or if no reassignment is available, asked to resign.

title: I'm attracted to my boss
author: listener
text: While you may be attracted to your boss, and your feelings may be strong, it might be in your best interests to resist acting upon them.

title: Why do I feel like I'm always wrong in everything in my relationship?
author: speaker
text: My wife is always accusing me of cheating and telling me that I'm doing things she finds disrespectful even when I don't mean it like that. For example, she gets offended when I call someone at work "sweetheart." I wish I had a penny for every time she accused me of cheating on her. She doesn't, and never will say she was wrong. How do I get her to understand?

title: Why do I feel like I'm always wrong in everything in my relationship?
author: listener
text: You may not get her to understand your point of view with any more success than your wife is having with you to do the same.It is possible you are a balanced couple in the sense of neither one of you understanding the other.The deeper question to ponder is whether each of you can accept the other person even though you each have very different terms for defining "cheating".You will find either there are enough strong similarities to keep the two of you happy as a couple, or there aren't these similarities.Then, the new question would be whether either of you want to address your findings or not.

title: What can I do if my coworkers accuse me of mood swings?
author: speaker
text: My coworkers are making false statements about me to the boss, saying I have mood swings. They have no proof to back it up. Can my employer make me see a therapist of their choice?

title: What can I do if my coworkers accuse me of mood swings?
author: listener
text: I can’t give you legal advice, but employers can suggest you see someone if your behavior is affecting your job.

title: What can I do if my coworkers accuse me of mood swings?
author: listener
text: I believe most government agencies have an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) where employees can talk to a therapist about any issue, not just work-related, for free (up to a certain amount of sessions).I’m wondering, though, why your coworkers would tell your boss this if it’s not true.

title: What can I do if my coworkers accuse me of mood swings?
author: listener
text: Is it possible that you're not aware of how your interactions are affecting others?

title: What can I do if my coworkers accuse me of mood swings?
author: listener
text: Maybe this “forced counseling” can be an opportunity for some introspection on your part.

title: How do I find myself?
author: speaker
text: I don't know what to say. I have never really known who I am.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: What exactly is it that you are looking for?

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Different people define themselves in different ways.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: For example, one person may define himself by his values and morals while another identifies herself by her personality and characteristics.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Still, another person may define himself by his interests and hobbies.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Learning who you are as a person can take time and life experience.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: At the same time, who you are may change according to what experiences you have had and how you have dealt with them or felt about them.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Try viewing the journey of finding yourself as exciting and ongoing.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Allow yourself to feel emotions and learn how they relate to the experiences you have.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: This may help you to know more about what you value, what you like and dislike, and what you want for yourself in life.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Best of luck to you!

title: How do I find myself?
author: speaker
text: I don't know what to say. I have never really known who I am.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Three years ago I attended a week long meditation retreat.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: By the fifth day I noticed I was light headed and felt very strange.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I began to realize within my own being an experience of no separation.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I would see others at the retreat and smile.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I loved them all.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I could feel the connection with this awareness I had read about but never truly understood until that moment.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I remember understanding all the teachings I had learned throughout my life about a god who existed outside of me.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I realized I had all these answeres within my own being and so did everyone else.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I began to see everyone as not just capable but powerful loving beings.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Since this experience it has been my desire for everyone to become conscious within whatever experience they wish.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I do this in many ways.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: At our studio we combine Mental Health with yoga and meditation as well as nutrition counseling to help people come to their optimal selves.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: To truly come into a state of "finding yourself," is to start to know and own who you are from a state of solid being.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: In this there is nothing new under the sun, and it is very simple.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I would love to teach you and anyone interested in coming into a state of awake conciousness.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: The more awake we are the more joyful we are.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I live in this state of being and demonstrate it in my daily life.

title: How do I find myself?

text: I don't know what to say. I have never really known who I am.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Therapy may be an effective way for you to get a stronger sense of who you are.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: A competent therapist will work to create a safe and curious therapeutic relationship in which you can explore your identity.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: There are also many different exercises which you can do in and out of therapy which you may find helpful in this area as well.

title: How do I find myself?

text: I don't know what to say. I have never really known who I am.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: This quiet wonder that you have is something you can easily explore.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: There is a part of you that you can access anytime, anywhere.

title: How do I find myself?

text: It is the part that has always been with you.

title: How do I find myself?

title: How do I find myself?

title: How do I find myself?

title: How do I find myself?

title: How do I find myself?

title: How do I find myself?

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Start by giving yourself enough quiet and time to remember about yourself what feels steady and consistent in your nature and interactions with others.Give yourself the freedom to your interest in having interests.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: Are you motivated because of competing with others or because an activity itself feels satisfying?If you are able to develop a sense of defining yourself without fear of judging yourself, you will start coming close to knowing who you are.

title: How do I find myself?
author: speaker
text: I don't know what to say. I have never really known who I am.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: This is perhaps the deepest question that one can ask of themselves and the answer is as elusive as the deepest enigma.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: We are fluid beings, we are never the same from day to day, we learn or unlearn, we evolve or some of us even devolve, we are in a state of constant flux, changing and adapting, like a cloud in the sky that has its shape changed by the wind, life whittles us away and carves us constantly, trying to understand this question is like trying to bite your own teeth, however we can have a sense of what we would call our core and to understand the core, we need to live and to experience, but also to think deeply, analytically, and critically, by engaging with life we get a sense that we are like the Earth itself, inside of us there is a core, just as there is inside our planet but our continents shift and change over time, like those continents so does our own nature shift throughout our lives.

title: How do I find myself?
author: speaker
text: I don't know what to say. I have never really known who I am.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I'm having the same issue...

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: I think you need to consider your morals and what you really want out of life.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: If there's something you want to achieve, that's who you are.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: And you need to put yourself into that and immerse yourself in the purpose of whatever you want.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener
text: It doesn't matter how small it may seem.

title: How do I find myself?
author: listener

title: How do I find myself?

title: How do I find myself?
