title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: speaker
text: I have PTSD. The side effects are really bad and have impacts on sex, anger and my relationships. I even lost my job month ago.    How can I get my life back?

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: This is a great question.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: PTSD can be very complex and debilitating.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: It must be very difficult for you at this time.When we feel complex emotions such as anger, frustration, and possibly low-self worth, the tendency is to try to avoid or suppress these emotions.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: The more you avoid them, the more these emotions will express themselves, and at the worst times.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: This may be why your PTSD symptoms are harming your relationships and your job status.To help you get your life back, it is important to process your emotions with a counselor that has specific training in trauma-informed interventions.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: To process emotions, you start by inviting them in, observe them with compassion and without judgment.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: When we observe our emotions, it starts the healing process because we separate ourselves from them.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: Remember, thoughts and emotions are constructed.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: You are not your thoughts, nor your emotions.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: They are messengers telling you to pay attention to them.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: The more we avoid the messengers, the louder they get, to the point that they are crippling you in more than one way.I hope this helps you begin your change process.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: For more information, please here is a link to a trauma post on my blog The Wisdom Room.Please reach out for help.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: And contact me with any questions.Sincerely~ Catherine ClevelandCleveland Emotional Health

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: speaker
text: I have PTSD. The side effects are really bad and have impacts on sex, anger and my relationships. I even lost my job month ago.    How can I get my life back?

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: Your feeling overwhelmed by emotion and finding it difficult to trust people.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: This can be a really scary feeling.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: It is a common reaction for individuals who have endured a traumatic experience.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: Often, the aftermath of a trauma can leave people feeling constantly on guard, panicky, depressed, isolated, and riddled with nightmares and intrusive thoughts of the incident.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: And while the signs and symptoms can feel complex and at times overwhelming, feeling better is more than possible.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: Give yourself credit for the courage that it takes to reach out.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: With trauma therapy, I would expect you will begin feeling better as we implement a compassionate and client-focused evidenced -based approach together.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: I've helped countless people to gain positive ground over their traumatic experiences in a safe, supportive environment.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: I offer a variety of evidenced based traditional therapies as well as holistic modalities to best support you on the path to healing.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: We will work together as allies in your treatment.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: It would be an honor to work with you.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: speaker
text: I have PTSD. The side effects are really bad and have impacts on sex, anger and my relationships. I even lost my job month ago.    How can I get my life back?

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: Hi there, I hear you, PTSD has a very debilitating effect on your whole life.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: I know that from personal experience.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: Recovering from it is possible and doable!

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: First is step is to acknowledge to yourself that your PTSD symptoms are a normal reaction to an abnormal and traumatic event.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: The nightmares, the anxiety, the heightened startle response - are all typical human responses following exposure to a frightening event.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: It's important that you don't blame yourself or your body for reacting this way, rather approach yourself with compassion and kindness that you would extend a friend who is hurting.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: The second step is to start taking steps towards healing.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: I would really encourage you to see a counselor or therapist specializing in trauma recovery so that you have a guided, step by step support.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: But if this is not an option, you can begin your healing on your own using a step-by-step approach outlined in the book, Healing Trauma, by Peter Levin.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: It's a very hands-on book and even comes with a CD audio guide.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: It has concrete exercises that you can do to help you eliminate dissociation, feel grounded, and decrease your anxiety response.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: I have used myself and with my clients with great success!

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: You can begin your recovery journey now with this video with Peter Levin's approach to Trauma Recovery: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nmJDkzDMllcOne last thing, I suggest consulting with a nutritionist or a doctor to help you boost your healing with supplements, vitamins, and minerals.

title: PTSD is impacting my whole life
author: listener
text: The stress from PTSD is very draining on the body, and you use up a lot of energy and resources, so at times of trauma supplements are quite necessary for recovery (Magnesium, Omega 3, Zinc, Vitamin C....etc)

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: speaker
text: I am a survivor of multiple sexual abuse/rape experiences. Triggers are having an effect on my daily life and my sexual relationship with my partner. I'm trying to learn to cope with them.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: Talking about it stops it from being a secret.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: It takes courage to have posted your question and that is the first step.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: Here is an article I wrote a few years back.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: http://abuseisnotasecret.com/why-abuse-is-not-your-fault/One day at a time.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: speaker
text: I am a survivor of multiple sexual abuse/rape experiences. Triggers are having an effect on my daily life and my sexual relationship with my partner. I'm trying to learn to cope with them.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: I'm glad you're willing to keep optimistic about life improving and offering better relationships than some of the ones in which you greatly suffered.One suggestion is to develop patience with yourself and the process of regaining your willingness to trust other people.Sexual intimacy engages all of who we truly are.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: Being cautious as to who and how much you allow someone into your life, is natural for anyone recovering from trauma.Allow yourself to withdraw when situations feel dangerous.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: Your sense of danger is most likely on higher alert than had you not been victimized.Be attentive and cooperate with your own sense of readiness to engage in conversation, discussions and sex with your partner.Explain all this to your partner so the person can develop their own patience with your recuperation process.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: speaker
text: I am a survivor of multiple sexual abuse/rape experiences. Triggers are having an effect on my daily life and my sexual relationship with my partner. I'm trying to learn to cope with them.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: I encourage you to seek out and work with a therapist who specializes in treating complex trauma.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: Somatic Experiencing, Brainspotting, and Internal Family Systems Therapy are all highly effective treatments for people dealing with complex trauma.

title: How do I cope with posttraumatic stress disorder and its triggers?
author: listener
text: If you are interested in reading a book that is supportive and compassionate, Bessel van der Kolk's The Body Keeps the Score is a wonderful book that discusses treatment options in depth.

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: speaker
text: My girlfriend was abused as a child. Now, if I hug or touch her in any kind of way she says she feels as if she is being abused as a child. What might be going on?

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: listener
text: Thank you for your question.

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: listener
text: I think it's wonderful that you are approaching this with openness and curiosity.

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: listener
text: The reaction you are describing is extremely common in survivors of abuse.

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: listener
text: What you said is insightful...when you touch her "she feels as if she is being abused as a child."

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: listener
text: From your description, I would agree that in those moments she is re-experiencing something that happened in the past as if it is happening right now.

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: listener
text: Re-experiencing or reliving traumatic experiences is a key symptom of PTSD.If you are seeking to better understand what is going on for her, I would highly recommend Bessel van der Kolk's book the Body Keeps the Score.

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: listener
text: This book also discusses effective treatments for overcoming trauma.

title: My girlfriend can't stand it when I touch her
author: listener
text: Best of luck to both of you,Sarah

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: speaker
text: I recently lost a friend to suicide. I'm smoking marijuana and drinking more to cope with it. How can I handle this better?

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: First of all, I am very sorry for your loss, and I can understand the urge to drink and smoke to try and cope.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: As I'm sure you understand, alcohol and marijuana may take the edge off of the pain in the short run, but in the long run they may prevent you from being able to work through the thoughts and feelings that you have about the loss of your friend.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: Grieving is a process that is unique to each individual and each relationship that may involve difficult, confusing, and even contradictory seeming thoughts and feelings and a competent therapist can help you work through this process.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: It also may be useful for you to add other ways of coping, such as taking care of yourself through exercise, doing healthy activities that you love, and spending time with people that you love.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: Self care is often most difficult when we need it the most.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: Thank you for reaching out.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: speaker
text: I recently lost a friend to suicide. I'm smoking marijuana and drinking more to cope with it. How can I handle this better?

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: I'm so sorry to hear about your recent loss.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: There is such a large feeling of uncertainty that befalls those of us left to sort through these emotions of such a loss, and it's never easy.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: I think it's important to remember that there is no "right" or "wrong" way to deal with loss and the "best way" for you may not be the best way for someone else.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: The fact that you are aware that you are smoking more marijuana and drinking more, and the fact that you can recognize that these may not be the best coping techniques, is a very good step towards giving yourself some better support at this time.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: Marijuana and drinking are type of coping techniques that can numb us to our emotions, but they do not really help us to work through those emotions.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: When it comes to grief, often one of the most helpful ways to move through the phases of grief is to use your social supports; talk to your friends and family, see your mutual friends and commiserate with each other on the loss and the uncertainty.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: The more we talk about our feelings, the more we are okay with them being ours.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: The more we express our loss, the better we become at accepting such a loss.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: In talking with your supports, you may also decide ways in which you may want to remember your friend; ways you can do so on a personal level (writing a poem, planting a tree, etc.)

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: or ways you as a group can remember and memorialize them (a special day where you get together to share your memories, starting a charity, etc.)

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: We never truly "get over" our losses, but we can learnt o accept the losses and what it means to us now...but that also takes time.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: speaker
text: I recently lost a friend to suicide. I'm smoking marijuana and drinking more to cope with it. How can I handle this better?

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: First I am so sorry for your loss.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: Most people go through the grieving process.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: I would get a better understanding of what that process is.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: Everyone has their own way of handling loss.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: You are taking the first step in realizing that you are having a difficult time coping with it.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: I would reach out to a therapist that has experience treatment patients with loss.

title: What is the best way to cope with the loss of someone to suicide?
author: listener
text: I would also recognize that drinking and smoking are both substances that will not make depression or depressive thoughts any better.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: speaker
text: I have family issues, and my dad was both violent and a cheater.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: Sorry that your growing up years in the family were so unsafe and painful.Everyone has family legacy patterns of behavior and ways of handling emotions, handed down to them simply by living.All of what any child observes and how they are treated within their family context, creates their foundational expectations of others.The best way of releasing yourself form hurtful interaction patterns is by being aware of your own feelings and intuition within close relationships.If you have a similar sense of hurt or that something is wrong, yet in a familiar way, then most likely you are in a relational pattern similar to the negative ones in your family of origin.This realization moment is your chance to more deeply see your own original trauma and try different ways of responding to these similar key situations.This type of work takes a lot of repeated effort because trauma is deep and childhood trauma is attached to loving ones parents.Expect slow progress and expect more than a few tears.If it feels overwhelming then a therapist for guidance and support would be very beneficial to the work you'd be doing within yourself.Sending lots of good luck!

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: speaker
text: I have family issues, and my dad was both violent and a cheater.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: Hi New York, There's no way to keep your past from affecting your present and future, because it's a huge part of who we are.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: The GOOD news is, though, that the effect doesn't have to be negative.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: I'm met many people who have horrific pasts and it helps them know confidently, every day, what kind of person they want to be and what kind of world they want to live in, and it helps them make really great decisions.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: You can accept your past, integrate your traumas and move forward in a very different way.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: If you see negative ways in which your past affects you (and this is also common), you are wise to seek professional help.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: Without knowing more, it's impossible to give you a lot of direction here.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: Basically, our past creates emotional "bruises" that are touch on and triggered by present situations.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: But our reactions are often about more than just the present moment.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: I think you know that.I wish you the best as you sort it out.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: speaker
text: I have family issues, and my dad was both violent and a cheater.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: In general, our past is always somewhat alive and does inform our present experiences.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: All past experiences, both positive and negative are what have brought you where you are today, physically and emotionally.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: That being said, your father's behavior does not have to define you or your future.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: You have power over your life and your future.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: By learning more about yourself, you can learn to incorporate your past into your present life, without being defined by past traumas.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: The best way to grow and learn how to do this is to talk with someone about your experiences.

title: How can I avoid having past traumatic experiences affect my present and future?
author: listener
text: By talking about your past and present struggles with a trusted confidante or helping professional you will hopefully learn how to be at peace with your past.

title: How do I let go of the abuse my dad showed me?
author: speaker
text: My dad beat and mentally abused me so badly that I can't function properly. Letting go of the past is important to moving on and getting better, but I’m terrified to get better because I don't even know who I am without the trauma. I've never gotten to be myself. I don't even know who I am.

title: How do I let go of the abuse my dad showed me?
author: listener
text: I am so sorry to hear that you are struggling.

title: How do I let go of the abuse my dad showed me?
author: listener
text: Getting to know yourself after a trauma (especially at the hands of a caregiver) and learning to trust yourself can feel terrifying.

title: How do I let go of the abuse my dad showed me?
author: listener
text: I would encourage you to seek out a trauma therapist who can work with you slowly and at your pace.

title: How do I let go of the abuse my dad showed me?
author: listener

title: How do I let go of the abuse my dad showed me?
author: listener
text: You are good and you are whole.

title: How do I let go of the abuse my dad showed me?
author: listener
text: Please seek out the support of a therapist who sees that in you.

title: How do I move on from almost being raped?
author: speaker
text: At a friend's house, we had some drinks and watched some television. He got up and went to bed. I felt sick. He came out to see if I was okay, and I said no. I said I wanted to go home, and he told me to come lay down. As I laid down on the bed, he started touching me. A friend called me, then I able to leave.

title: How do I move on from almost being raped?
