title: What can I do about my boyfriend being so close with another girl?
author: speaker
text: My boyfriend has this close female friend. It always bothered me because of how close they are, so I decided to meet her. That made the situation worse because they were even closer than what I thought. They acted like a couple rather than friends with each other. There was no physical interaction, but he talks to this girl a lot. What can I do? Leaving him isn't an option.

title: What can I do about my boyfriend being so close with another girl?
author: listener
text: I wonder if you could have a conversation with your boyfriend about how you are feeling.

title: What can I do about my boyfriend being so close with another girl?
author: listener
text: A few things may help with that:Try having the conversation you are both able to have a conversation about something that is important (for example, not during a commercial for a TV show)Maybe your boyfriend will be willing to listen to you for about five minutes asking questions to learn more about your experience, kind of like an investigative reporter wouldSee if your boyfriend is able to capture the essence of what you're saying by summarizing it for youRemember that hearing you and following what you're saying does not mean that he agreesAlso consider if there are events in your past that are affecting the way you are looking at this relationship between your boyfriend and this other girl (we all bring our own histories into relationships and we unconsciously expect that what has worked in other relationships will work in current ones)Then you can switch so that you can hear more about what he is experiencing (for example, what it is that he likes about her)Also consider having a discussion that if one of you becomes very emotional and needs a break from the discussion, discuss having a timeout that will last for a certain time frame (usually between 15 minutes and one hour) and then come back to continue the discussionRemember that the goal here is just to learn more about what each of you is going through, not to find a solution right awayThis can be difficult.

title: What can I do about my boyfriend being so close with another girl?
author: listener
text: Consider working with a couples therapist to discuss it together.

title: What can I do about my boyfriend being so close with another girl?
author: speaker
text: My boyfriend has this close female friend. It always bothered me because of how close they are, so I decided to meet her. That made the situation worse because they were even closer than what I thought. They acted like a couple rather than friends with each other. There was no physical interaction, but he talks to this girl a lot. What can I do? Leaving him isn't an option.

title: What can I do about my boyfriend being so close with another girl?
author: listener
text: Well, as hurtful as witnessing your boyfriend's closeness with his female friend, I"m glad you saw firsthand the dynamic of your concern.There isn't anything you can directly do to stop his relationship with this lady.It is possible to influence his side of their relationship.Directly telling him your discomfort with how close the two are, may make him pause before engaging with her in a discussion.

title: What can I do about my boyfriend being so close with another girl?
author: listener
text: This is nothing to count on since the control is in his hands and not yours.I'm sorry to read that the option to leave this relationship is out of the question.The only way left is to get used to the fact that you don't like this aspect of your boyfriend, and this is a disheartening outlook overall to you and to your relationship overall.If after repeated effort to influence him by your opinions, your effort to adjust to a situation you don't like, if at all possible, consider a longterm plan to discontinue this relationship because by that time it may feel very oppressive in your life.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: speaker
text: I’m a man, and I’m soon to be married. I have been messing around with other men on the side. It started as a once in a while thing, but it’s been happening a lot. I don't know what to do.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Hello, and thank you for your question.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: When faced with these kinds of difficult challenges, I usually encourage people to look to their values for help in determining what their behavior should be.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Indeed, it is usually when our behaviors conflict with our values that we don't feel very content with our lives.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Perhaps you can take some time to think through a couple of these questions: What kind of person do I want to be deep in my heart?

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: What kind of character do I want to have when in public and in my private world when nobody is watching?

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: How would I want others to describe me?

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Let's say that you want others to see you as being authentic, and YOU also value authenticity as something you want to live by.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: You may feel like this value is currently at odds with the behaviors you are engaging in right now.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: That you are not being the person that you really are deep in your heart.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: This is not an unusual struggle when it comes to sexual behavior and sexual orientation.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: So please, try not to feel alone.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: We all know quite well how unacceptable it may be to be seen as gay, lesbian, bisexual, etc.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: And I am not just talking about being unaccepted by others, but a person may have a VERY hard time accepting themselves.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Thinking about your values and living a life based on them can bring a lot of freedom, but I won't lie, it can also bring a lot of pain at the same time.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: For example, someone with the value of living authentically may decide they have to tell others who they are and what they stand for, even if that means people may disapprove.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: That may cause a lot of pain, but it may also come with a sense of freedom to live a life based on honesty and authenticity.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: It may be helpful to find a counselor who is trained in affirmative therapy, which is recommended for people who are navigating their sexual behaviors and figuring out what is right for them.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: I would also sit down and think through some of the questions above and consider what your values are... both as an individual and as someone's fiancé.Above all, I wish you well in this journey.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Robin J. Landwehr, DBH, LPC, NCC

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: speaker
text: I’m a man, and I’m soon to be married. I have been messing around with other men on the side. It started as a once in a while thing, but it’s been happening a lot. I don't know what to do.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: It took a lot of courage to share what must be so shameful to you and to ask for help.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Regardless of your sexual attraction/orientation, I'd encourage you to get honest with yourself and your partner/fiancee and put a temporary hold on your wedding plans -- getting married will NOT resolve your acting out.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: It seems to me you need more space, time to sort through with an experienced therapist more of your sex/sexuality story-line and apparent anxiety surrounding the upcoming nuptials.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: In the immediate I encourage you to also take the initiative to have yourself tested for STDs, etc.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: and if you've been sexually intimate with your partner/fiancee s/he needs to be similarly tested.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Best wishes.Resources for Your Consideration: 1) The book "Not Gay: Sex between Straight White Men" by Jane Ward, 2) http://www.sca-recovery.org/, 3) https://slaafws.org/

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: speaker
text: I’m a man, and I’m soon to be married. I have been messing around with other men on the side. It started as a once in a while thing, but it’s been happening a lot. I don't know what to do.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: I would start by examining the reasons for seeking out other relationships.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Are you getting something from the other men that you do not currently receive from your current partner?

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: Such as, is it more exciting with others and that excitement is lacking in your current relationship?

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: speaker
text: I’m a man, and I’m soon to be married. I have been messing around with other men on the side. It started as a once in a while thing, but it’s been happening a lot. I don't know what to do.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: If you are happy with the person that you are about to be married to and are also enjoying time with other men, it could be possible that you are attracted to people of more than one gender.Having said that, some people have feelings toward people of more than one gender that are not really related to romance or attraction, but any number of other feelings, such as trust and communication.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: I don't know whether your use of the phrase "messing around" was related specifically to being romantically or sexually involved with the people who you are or referring to or if you are saying that you are enjoying spending time with them.

title: I'm soon to be married, and I've been messing around with others
author: listener
text: These terms have different definitions for almost everyone.I would definitely recommend speaking with a local mental health practitioner in your area, not because there is anything wrong about the way you are feeling, but because there are a lot of different parts of what is happening in your life right now and it may be helpful to talk about the feelings and thoughts with someone who can help you to learn more about yourself and the people are most important in your life (yourself included).I also suggest looking at a few things that you love and appreciate about yourself.

title: My friend had lied about every aspect of her life—what do I do?
author: speaker
text: She has lied about every aspect of her life. She's created three fake relationships. The most recent one is concerning because she has fake photos, phone calls, and text messages, and it’s with a married man with kids. Her lying is becoming dangerous because she could ruin lives.

title: My friend had lied about every aspect of her life—what do I do?
author: listener
text: Have an honest and open conversation with her about how her behavior is negatively impacting you ( and others).

title: My friend had lied about every aspect of her life—what do I do?
author: listener
text: You will feel good knowing you did the right thing.

title: My friend had lied about every aspect of her life—what do I do?
author: speaker
text: She has lied about every aspect of her life. She's created three fake relationships. The most recent one is concerning because she has fake photos, phone calls, and text messages, and it’s with a married man with kids. Her lying is becoming dangerous because she could ruin lives.

title: My friend had lied about every aspect of her life—what do I do?
author: listener
text: To be honest, I think more information would be really important here because what you are asking could have a lot of different meanings.

title: My friend had lied about every aspect of her life—what do I do?
author: listener
text: Consider making an appointment with a local therapist to discuss what you are going through.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: speaker
text: My boyfriend lost his dad to suicide. He says that because his dad died, so did his heart. He says that he can't be there for me or love me anymore and wants nothing to do with me ever again. Why is he doing this when we were very happy together? He says that I have done nothing wrong but he just can't be with me.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: I am sorry to learn of this.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: You must be extremely frustrated and heartbroken.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: To begin, he is correct.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: You have done nothing wrong.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: This is entirely a coping mechanism in overdrive.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: It is fear.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: It is anger.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: It is extreme sadness.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: It is feelings of abandonment.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: It is intense emotional pain.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: It is his way of protecting himself from potential unexpected additional loss.I am not familiar with how old this post is, but often, it will require time and understanding.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: If he speaks with you, encourage him to get grief counseling.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: Do not encourage it for your relationship, encourage it for his betterment coping with losing his dad.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: Start there.

title: My boyfriend wants nothing to do with me after his dad's suicide
author: listener
text: Good Luck.

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: speaker
text: When my boyfriend gets in a snit, he gives me the silent treatment for days. When I ask what is wrong, I get nothing: no reply, no phone call. If he does reply, it is something very sarcastic and hurtful. He never admits he is wrong and never apologizes.

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: listener
text: Try during a good moment between you to tell him you'd like to talk over something about your relationship and that you'd like to set a time with him to do so.When a person shuts down and withdraws, the only choice is to withdraw yourself.

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: listener
text: If this continues on a regular basis, after a while the two of you will become increasingly distant and have developed the very unhappy habit of not clearing the air between the two of you.Good for you to recognize a problem and be willing to address it!

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: speaker
text: When my boyfriend gets in a snit, he gives me the silent treatment for days. When I ask what is wrong, I get nothing: no reply, no phone call. If he does reply, it is something very sarcastic and hurtful. He never admits he is wrong and never apologizes.

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: listener
text: This sounds very hurtful for you to be on the receiving end of this.

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: listener
text: You can ask yourself " what am I learning from the way I am being treated? "

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: listener
text: and consider whether or not this is in fact either (1)  A message or value that you agree with and believe will strengthen your relationship and help you to grow as a person or (2)  A message or value that is damaging to the relationship or  to your view of your self and others.

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: listener
text: Once you've considered that and come to your own conclusion, you will likely know what you need to do.

title: How do I handle getting the silent treatment from my boyfriend?
author: listener
text: If you're still stuck, you may want to consider seeing an individual therapist for yourself  to process your feelings about the relationship or a couples therapist with your partner to work on improving your communication with each other.

title: Should I stay with my manipulative husband?
author: speaker
text: Every day for five years, my husband mentally abused me and said he will change. I have a child with him. I try so hard to stay strong for her, but at this point, I am completely broken. I am holding on to nothing but hope and have been for years. Is there any hope or am I wasting my time?

title: Should I stay with my manipulative husband?
author: listener
text: I think your own awareness will not allow you to continue in a bad relationship.Be glad something within you is telling you that there are better ways to be treated than how your husband does.For support and guidance in real time, look up the organizations in your area which help women to leave abusive relationships.You are not the first or only one and probably not the last woman who wants to leave an abusive partner.

title: Should I stay with my manipulative husband?
author: listener
text: Having guidance particular to you and your situation will help you move through what decisions to make as to how to leave this man.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: speaker
text: I have been pushing people away all my life. I finally have a great boyfriend who loves me, but I keep pushing him away and I don't want to. I need to learn to open up.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: Figuring out the space we need between ourselves and others is an ongoing and unsolvable task.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: But it sounds like you may be feeling stuck in a pattern of pushing people away and are wanting to change that.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: Pushing others away may be your way of surviving relationships and may have proven to be very helpful at one point in your life.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: Or it may be serving some other purpose.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: One helpful way to consider changing that is to seek out a therapist.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: Psychotherapy can provide you with a relationship that is in tune to you and that can provide the reflection and supportive challenges to help determine the function the 'pushing away' is serving.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: It also may be helpful for you to take time to reflect on the moments when interpersonal guardedness snuck its way into the interaction.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: What were you feeling right before this?

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: Did it provide relief?

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: Reflecting on what was happening just before and right after can provide some clues as to what purpose the 'pushing away' serves.It may be helpful to communicate to the boyfriend how you experience intimacy and the discomfort it can bring you at times.

title: How can I open up to the ones I love?
author: listener
text: This may help him be as sensitive as you need him to be about the pace of the relationship, and to understand what may be happening when you push him away.

title: My boyfriend's family expects him to take them on dates, and he doesn't think anything's wrong
author: speaker
text: I have been dating my boyfriend for eight years. We met in college off away from home and things went from good to bad when I met his family who treats him like he is their man. They expect him to take them on dates like to the movies and out to eat when they come around, and he thinks it's okay.

title: My boyfriend's family expects him to take them on dates, and he doesn't think anything's wrong
author: listener
text: Well, then you learned something new about your boyfriend!Are you fine with having a different opinion than him and staying together.Think over how major a problem this is to you and if it is reason enough to leave the relationship.There are always plenty of areas of disagreement between partners in a relationship.The key to being happy is to know which ones you can accept and which ones are beyond your tolerance with which to live.Also, an early step would be to directly tell your boyfriend your opinion.

title: My boyfriend's family expects him to take them on dates, and he doesn't think anything's wrong
author: listener
text: He may be willing to change his ways to satisfy you.

title: What can I do about my fiancé putting his family first before our family?
author: speaker
text: My fiancé of 15 years is always helping out his family, and I feel like his family takes advantage of his kindness. We're about to get married this Saturday, but I feel like he is always gonna put them first instead of myself and our three kids. I am not enjoying our engagement at all.

title: What can I do about my fiancé putting his family first before our family?
author: listener
text: Congrats on your upcoming wedding!Have you told the thoughts you write here, to your fiancé ?This is the place to start since you clearly are unhappy with a part of his and now your life, which will be with you for quite some time.

title: Can someone love you and say hurtful things?
author: speaker
text: Someone I care about told me I'm not teachable and I'm irritating. I just want to be happy and wanted to please the person, but I always fall short it seems.

title: Can someone love you and say hurtful things?
author: listener
text: Pleasing someone certainly does feel satisfying.

title: Can someone love you and say hurtful things?
author: listener
text: If the other person does not appreciate your effort and good will then this feels dissatisfying.Offering happiness to someone does not include tolerating mean comments such as the ones you describe here.Tell the person that you are trying to please them and also tell the person that their comments are hurtful.If the person said their words with no bad intentions then next time they comment its reasonable to expect these comments to not hurt your feelings.Keep in mind that your good intentions may not be received in the way you intend them.

title: Can someone love you and say hurtful things?
author: listener
text: Some people, sometimes are insensitive or just plain not interested in being pleased by another person.

title: Am I being picky when it comes to my boyfriend?
author: speaker
text: I've been in a relationship for almost a year, and I absolutely trust my boyfriend. He treats me nice, checks on me, and tells me sweet things. However, when it comes to making life decisions, I feel he is very immature. I try to talk things out so we can compromise or make sound decisions together, but he lacks any ideas and prefers to just go with anything to avoid fighting. As far as dates, if I don't say anything, plan it, or have money to chip in, we will not go. I feel like I put in a lot of work supporting and sometimes spoiling, and all I get is a loyal man who will not cheat and say sweet things on occasion.

title: Am I being picky when it comes to my boyfriend?
author: listener
text: Well, then your decision is whether you want to stay in this type of relationship or not.One point to keep in mind is this.Just because he's not telling you his opinions doesn't mean he doesn't have any opinions.In the long run t is always easier to talk with someone about their differences from our point of view than to be someone who doesn't tell you what is in their mind.Short term it seems easy to have someone agreeable.Long term someone who doesn't tell you their thoughts and who disagrees with you, may potentially go about their true wishes in hidden ways.

title: What should I do after finding my boyfriend flirting on dating websites?
author: speaker
text: I found the guy I’m dating on dating websites. He was telling women that they were beautiful. He said it wasn’t him and that the phone was hacked. It has since happened two other times. He says he loves me and I’m the only girl he wants to be with, but I feel he is not telling me the truth.

title: What should I do after finding my boyfriend flirting on dating websites?
author: listener
text: Tell him what you know and ask why he is lying to you.

title: What should I do after finding my boyfriend flirting on dating websites?
author: listener
text: If he tells you he isn't lying and you have proof that he is, then you can either accept that he denies the truth or not.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: speaker
text: My boyfriend won't touch me intimately, he won't kiss me while we are having sex and he won't have oral sex with me. I know he has done this things with other women in the past. I don't know why he won't do them with me. What should I do?

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: First off, don't blame yourself or be too quick to jump to any scary conclusions.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: Human sexuality can be incredibly complex at times (e.g., what turns us on at one time may not be what turns us on the next time).

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: There could actually be a number of things going on including him having performance anxiety...maybe he had a bad experience with a previous partner that's left him scared to try again (we call this operant conditioning).

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: It could also be that he puts you in a different category than previous lovers.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: Sometimes I refer to this as the "hooker-housewife mentality" where a partner somehow gets the idea that when we truly fall in love, we treat that one differently; almost up on a pedestal.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: Drives many partners crazy until they're aware that this is going on and give their boyfriend/ girlfriend permission to enjoy both the naughty and the nice with them.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: It could also be that he's not even aware that he's not doing these things.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: If you haven't asked him yet, you might try gently approaching the subject when you're not already in the bedroom or trying to get in on and inquire what he most enjoys about sex with you (or has enjoyed in the past, or thinks he might enjoy).

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: You can also share your favorite highlights of sex with him.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: Give him an ego boost and tell him what he does well while then asking him if he'd be down to go downtown.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: "Baby, it REALLY turns me on when you kiss me during sex.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: "If you continue to get the impression that it's somehow only about YOU or that he's just really hesitant to talk about sex in general, you might see if he'd be cool to chat with a counselor who specializes in sexual intimacy.

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: speaker
text: My boyfriend won't touch me intimately, he won't kiss me while we are having sex and he won't have oral sex with me. I know he has done this things with other women in the past. I don't know why he won't do them with me. What should I do?

title: My boyfriend does not do some sexual things with me that he has done with other people
author: listener
text: Ask him!Having a conversation about sexual satisfaction increases emotional intimacy.Not only will you potentially feel more deeply connected from a sincere conversation about your sexual questions, maybe this increased emotional closeness will inspire the sexual closeness you wish to receive.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: speaker
text: I'm 15 and my girlfriend is 14. Am I a pedophile because I'm attracted to her and she's under 18?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Nope!

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: In fact you are NOT a pedophile.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: That term is reserved for older adolescents attracted to children, or adults who are attracted to children.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: I see an age difference as being one key factor in determining pedophilia if the older person is still in adolescence.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: You being only a year older than your girlfriend doesn't qualify, so go right ahead and be attracted to your girlfriend without shame!

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

text: I'm 15 and my girlfriend is 14. Am I a pedophile because I'm attracted to her and she's under 18?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

text: You're under 18, too.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: This is absolutely normal.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

text: What would be wrong is if you did anything to her against her will.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Always remember that NO means NO, respect her, respect yourself, and be a normal teenager!

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Have a healthy relationship.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Holding hands, kissing, and more should only be done when both are comfortable with it and agree to it.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Although it is frowned upon by a lot of people, it's no secret that teenagers do have sex (even if their parents and perhaps religion would definitely not want them to do it).

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Only you can make the choice that is right for you.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Just be responsible in the choices you make.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: Some states have laws on what age is old enough for consensual sex.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: You'd be surprised how young those ages are.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: A 14 year old having sex with a 20 year old would be against the law, but someone the same age as her, or just one year older is not.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: "Wrong" can be defined in a lot of different ways, though.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

text: Is it against the law?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: No.

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

title: Is it wrong for me to be attracted to my girlfriend?

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: speaker
text: I crossdress and like to be feminine but I am attracted to women, but yet that seems to bother girls I date or ask out.    How can I approach them about it? should I hold back and keep it a secret, or should I just be up-front about it. I wonder if i should stop or if I should continue to do it since it makes me happy. What should I do?

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: Thanks for asking this question.

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: I think the most important part of what you mentioned was that you do it because it makes you happy.

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: For that reason, I would encourage you to keep doing what makes you happy.As far as telling girls or keeping it a secret, I don't really think that it's necessarily one or the other, at least not the first time that you meet.

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: In other words, one part of your decision-making could be whether it is something that you always want to address in the first date, or perhaps something that you address after you've known each other for a couple of meetings.

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: The answer to that question may also change depending on who you are dating.

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: I would imagine that each person that you are with mainly due to a different decision this was when to disclose this.

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: It sounds like this is an important part of you, so I would think that if you were going to date someone long-term, you would want them to know about the most important parts of you, including that.I also encourage you to remember that if you meet someone who is not comfortable with this, that does not mean that there is anything wrong with what you are doing, but rather something that the other person is in some way deciding not to continue learning about or choosing to have someone they are dating like to cross-dress.I'd also ask you to consider this: Are the people who you say this to expecting it?

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: My guess is that the answer is probably not.

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener
text: Along with that, Are they going to have questions?

title: How do I tell a girl that I crossdress?
author: listener

title: My husband was lying about drinking again
author: speaker
text:
My husband has had issues with alcohol addiction in the past (he'd never admit to this). A while back (3 years ago), I asked him to stop drinking so much, and he agreed. I caught him one night drinking behind my back. I confronted him and he lied, but I told him I knew he was lying because I counted the beers in the fridge and four of them were missing. He admitted and apologized and promised he wouldn't do it again. Lately, my husband has been drinking on and off, but I noticed it was every single night. I didn't like this. For our New Year’s resolution, we decided we were going to limit our alcohol consumption. He was on board—no more drinking every night.
 The other night, I counted the beers in the fridge just to see if some were missing. It took a couple of days, but tonight, I discovered a few were missing along with a shot of vodka. He was passed out on the couch when I decided to wake him up and confront him (poor timing, but I couldn't wait). I asked him if he'd come to bed with me (when he drinks, he snores and I cannot sleep—it's a dead giveaway he's been drinking). He slurred a bit and said no. I asked if he had been drinking, but he snapped and said no. I went into our room to sleep, leaving him on the couch.  I'm not sure if I'm overreacting or not. I just feel like I'm so honest with him about everything, and I expect the same honesty. He is a good husband in every other regard.

title: My husband was lying about drinking again
author: listener
text: As exasperated as you feel, and as obvious it is to you that your husband cares more about drinking than being honest with you, changing this is up to him.Does he care that you're upset with him for drinking more than he can handle?Does he care about you more than drinking?Living with an alcoholic, which is how his behavior sounds, is lonely and frustrating.Concentrate on what you like about him as he is now with his drinking.Your happiness matters.

title: My husband was lying about drinking again
author: listener
text: His ignoring of what you're talking about, doesn't mean your requests are unreasonable.Be prepared to learn to live with and accept how he behaves, or not.Avoid the expectation that you can convince him to change.People change only when they realize their life can improve by changing.

title: My husband was lying about drinking again
author: listener
text: He doesn't sound like this, at least now.

title: Why can't I get an erection with my girlfriend?
author: speaker

title: Why can't I get an erection with my girlfriend?
author: listener
text: I'm sorry to hear of your problem.First step as always when a possible medical explanation exists, go for a urology check up to either your internist or a urologist.Once you know there is no medical reason which would prevent an erection, then we can consider the psychological and emotion based factors.Maybe you're nervous about your sexual performance or that your gf may be disappointed in your performance.Men often mistake their own fears of performance failure with the assumption that their partner thinks about sex as a performance.Talk with your gf about whatever is on your mind which may inhibit you from enjoying sex.The reasons are endless.What matters is to have a heartfelt dialogue with each other.The emotional support which comes through such an intimate conversation may very well be the catalyst for a more relaxed and satisfying approach to sex w your gf.

text: Looking at more of what you like or would like to feel may be of help.

title: What should I do about not being sexually attracted to my girlfriend of five years?
author: speaker
text: Nothing we've tried has worked so far.

title: What should I do about not being sexually attracted to my girlfriend of five years?
author: listener
text: Probably what you should do is decide whether you can continue having a romantic and sexual relationship with someone to whom you don't feel like having sex.Five years is long enough to know that the way you feel toward your partner is more than likely going to remain this way.Talk with your gf about your feelings because she may not wish to be in a relationship in which her partner is not sexually attracted to her.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: speaker
text: My wife works late most days, so I'm lonely. I love my wife with all my heart, however I don't feel the intimacy we used to have. We don't have sex anymore, which bothers me tremendously. I have become close friends with a coworker, which I know is not helping. Nothing will happen with that, but there’s the thought.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: First things first!

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Friendships that develop in times of struggle may be a great emotional support, but also become confusing there's sexual attraction.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: And entertaining a tough is only going to make it a stronger target.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Careful with that friendship!

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: You do not want to fill your marriage's void with another person.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Even when you are in a friend zone and not having intimacy with this person, you may be developing a special bond, sharing interest and activities that may lead to a deeper connection.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Ask yourself how you would feel if your spouse was having a friendship like that.Then try to refocus on your marriage.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: I suggest being transparent and talking to your wife about your feelings and concerns.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Ask her what you could do to reconnect, make some suggestions and dedicate time to practice them.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Make time in both of your schedules, make an effort to have lunch together, or to text during the day.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Remember that a marriage is like a very good friendship with benefits, but sometimes the responsibility kills the fun.¿Cómo puedo volver a enamorarme de mi esposa?Mi esposa trabaja tarde casi todos los días, la amo con todo mi corazón, pero no siento la intimidad como antes.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Ya no tenemos sexo, lo cual me molesta tremendamente.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Me he acercado a una amistad del trabajo, lo cual no ayuda.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Nada pasara, pero hay pensamientos al respecto.Primero lo primero!

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Las amistades que se desarrollan en momentos de crisis pueden ser un gran apoyo emocional, pero también pueden convertirse en algo nebuloso cuando hay atracción sexual.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Entretener pensamientos al respecto solo lo va a hacer un reto más grande.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: ¡Ten cuidado con esa amistad!

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: No quieres llenar el vacío que deja tu matrimonio con esta nueva persona.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Aunque no estés teniendo intimidad con esa persona, puedes estar creando una conexión especial, compartiendo intereses en común y actividades que los unen más aun.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Pregúntate como te sentirías si tu esposa tuviera una amistad así.Intenta reenfocarte en tu matrimonio.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Sugiero que seas transparente con tu esposa y le dejes saber tu preocupación y como te sientes con el distanciamiento.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Pregúntale que le gustaría hacer para reconectarse, sugiérele algunas ideas y dediquen tiempo a las mismas.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Hagan tiempo en sus agendas para ustedes, hagan un esfuerzo para almorzar juntos, y comunicarse durante el día, aunque sea con textos.

title: How do I fall back in love with my wife?
author: listener
text: Recuerda que el matrimonio es como una muy buena amistad con beneficios y muchas veces las responsabilidades matan la diversión.

title: How do I stop feeling jealous in my relationship?
author: speaker
text: My boyfriend and I have been going out for about a year. I suddenly find myself jealous when I see him talking to other girls. I have never been this way before. I don't like these feelings. He said that my jealousy would cause our relationship to have problems. I told him I can't help these feelings. I don't know where they are coming from, but this is how I feel, I tried to stop, but I can't. I really like this guy, but I'm afraid that I'm messing up the relationship. It's just stupid.

title: How do I stop feeling jealous in my relationship?
author: listener
text: Trust is at the top of what makes a healthy relationship.

title: How do I stop feeling jealous in my relationship?
author: listener
text: It sounds like you may benefit from personal counseling to explore where this jealousy comes from and what keeps you from having complete trust in your boyfriend.

title: How do I stop feeling jealous in my relationship?
author: listener
text: This is not stupid, this is your mind telling you that there is something that needs to be worked through.

title: How do I stop feeling jealous in my relationship?
author: listener
text: Sometimes we need to talk to someone like a counselor who is disconnected from our life to understand our feelings and what they mean in our relationships.

title: My boyfriend wants to know every details of my sex life
author: speaker
text: We've been dating for two months now. I have a heavy past that gets him angry. Does he have a right to penalize me for things I did before I met him?

title: My boyfriend wants to know every details of my sex life
author: listener
text: How is he penalizing you?Have you asked for his reasons for wanting to know about your heavy past?His answers may be very different than that he would like penalizing you.What you can do is explain how pressured you feel by his questions.Ideally, the two of you will become much closer by talking openly about your respective discomforts and wishes from the other.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: speaker
text: There are intimate things she did early in the relationship, and things she had once agreed to try that she will not do now. I end up thinking about it all day. I feel rejected and think I married the wrong person.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: My wife won't do things she used to doThere are intimate things she did early in the relationship, and things she had once agreed to try that she will not do now.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: I end up thinking about it all day.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: I feel rejected and think I married the wrong person.Like we often hear, communication is the key to a good relationship.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Intimacy in the marriage is something we take for granted, and we rarely communicate about it.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: I noticed how you mentioned that she had “once agreed to try” things; did you ever asked if she enjoyed those things or would want to repeat them.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Have you asked if she would like to try new things as well?What if, you work on improving your communication with your wife?

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: One thing to consider is the status of your relationship.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Are you in good terms with each other?

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Are you or your wife going under a stressful situation?

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Many times when we have problems we reflect it in multiple areas, including our intimacy or lack of it.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Listen to her; ask how you can support her.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Find ways to reconnect as a couple, relax, have fun, and do things that you used to enjoy, or discover new interests together.Then you can focus on having conversations about your intimacy.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: You could star by letting her know that you are concerned about your romantic life, and ask if you do anything that she likes or dislikes.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Remember this is a two-way street, you should be ready to listen and ready to share.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Take in consideration what she mentions, and work on resolving those issues.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: It is important that you praise each other as you progress and do this in a loving and supportive way, avoiding hurtful comments.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: If you continue to struggle, or seems difficult to engage in communicating with your wife, consider couples therapy or individual therapy to work on communication skills.Mi esposa no hace las cosas que solía hacerHay cosas intimas que ella hacia al principio de nuestra relación, y cosas que alguna vez ella estuvo de acuerdo en probar y que ahora no hace.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Yo  me paso pensando en eso todo el día.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Me siento rechazado y pienso que me case con la persona equivocada.Como tanto escuchamos, comunicación es la clave para una buena relación.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: La intimidad en el matrimonio es algo de damos por hecho y rara vez nos comunicamos al respecto.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Noté como mencionas que alguna vez tu esposa “estuvo de acuerdo en probar” algo.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: ¿Alguna vez le preguntaste si le gusto lo que probo, o si quería repetirlo?

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: ¿Le has preguntado si ella quisiera intentar algo nuevo o diferente?¿Y qué tal si trabajas en mejorar la comunicación con tu esposa?Un aspecto a considerar es si hay alguna tención en el matrimonio.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Si están pasando por una situación tensa en su matrimonio o algún otro aspecto de su vida, lo pueden estar reflejando en su intimidad, o la falta de la misma.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Escúchala, pregunta cómo puedes darle apoyo.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Encuentra maneras de reconectar en pareja, relajarse, divertirse, y hacer cosas que antes disfrutaban, o descubrir nuevos intereses juntos.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Si demuestran que son importantes uno para el otro y apoyan sus necesidades, se unirán más y disfrutaran de su tiempo intimo.Luego trabaja en tener conversaciones sobre la intimidad.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Puedes empezar por dejarle saber que te preocupa la vida romántica preguntarle si hay algo que a ella le agrada o desagrada al respecto.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Recuerda que esto será beneficioso para los dos, tú debes estar preparado para escucharla, y compartir tus preocupaciones.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Toma en consideración lo que ella mencione, y trabaja en resolver o eliminar esas conductas.

title: My wife won't do things she used to do
author: listener
text: Es importante que se alaguen y animen en el proceso, que este sea un proceso de apoyo y crecimiento y que continúen teniendo esta conversación frecuentemente.Si continuas teniendo dificultad o no sabes cómo comunicarte con tu pareja, considera terapia de pareja como una alternativa, o incluso consejería individual para trabajar en tus destrezas de comunicación.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: speaker
text: We don't have sex a lot. I cheat when we argue. I don't kiss or have unprotected sex with them. It's a one time thing, and I never see them twice.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text: Hello, and thank you for your question.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
The question about
whether or not to cheat is based on personal values that can only be answered
by you.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
However, here are a few things to consider and questions to ask
yourself to help you find your answer:
1.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
Do you feel like you are violating your own
values or morals?

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
This is important, because we all have different values and
morals surrounding sex, love, and monogamy.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
If you value monogamous
relationships and find yourself cheating on your partner, then you may feel
like you are living in contradiction to your values, and most people are not
happy when they do that.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
However, if monogamy is not something you value, then
perhaps it is time to re-evaluate the relationship and determine if it is still
right for you.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
Not all people want monogamous relationships, and that
is alright.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
Finally, if you value your husband’s feelings and know that the
affairs would hurt him, then your behaviors may again be in contrast to your
own values.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text: That can only be determined by you.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
Based on how you describe your relationship, it
sounds like you are not very satisfied with the way it is.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
From the outside, it looks like the affairs
are a way to “get even” with your husband or to feel better after an argument.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
This
is something that can happen when mutual respect starts to fade in a
relationship and gets replaced with contempt.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
We can simply stop caring about
how our actions hurt each other, or potentially hurt each other.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
Perhaps the
question to ask here is, when you look out toward the future with your husband,
is this the pattern that you want to keep?

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
The pattern of very little sex,
argument, and then satisfying the pain or dissatisfaction with affairs.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text: What are your goals for this relationship?

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
If we
start to become disconnected in a relationship, we can begin to do things on
autopilot.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text: Get up, get the kids up, go to work, come home, and go to bed.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
None
of which requires any intimacy at all.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
Are you still able to see the hopes and
dreams you once had for this relationship?

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text: Have you considered seeking marital counseling?

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
Not
having affairs won’t actually fix the part of the relationship that is leading
you to have them.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
If there is something broken, it sometimes requires some help
to get it fixed.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
Hopefully these questions and thoughts will help you come to
some kind of conclusion about what is right for you and your relationship.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text:
I certainly
wish you well.

title: Is it wrong to cheat on my husband?
author: listener
text: Robin J. Landwehr, DBH, LPC, NCC

title: I am afraid of sex
author: speaker
text: I am a female, and I am afraid of having sex. I am afraid of disappointing my partner by being inexperienced. I think he thinks I'm not a virgin. I am also scared that he will be disappointed with my naked body. I don't want my partner to think differently of me because I am afraid of having sex.

title: I am afraid of sex
author: listener
text: As hard as it may be to do this, since all the media and marketing of how an ideal person looks and performs sexually, surrounds us, keep in mind that the images presented in order to sell movies and almost any product, is meant to trigger fantasies.No one is a fantasy, we are all real and unique.

title: I am afraid of sex
author: listener
text: We can be influenced to believe that being a fantasy is better than being who each of us is, genuinely.Your partner may be much more accepting of your body and your level of sexual experience, than you are of yourself!Sex within a relationship means the two people want to have with the other one, not because they have ideal bodies and expertise, but because the person wants to make love to the one whom they love.When you are in a loving relationship, part of this includes talking about sensitivities and insecurities.

title: I am afraid of sex
author: listener
text: Having a conversation gives the chance to know that you are accepted for who you are, not how closely you resemble a made up idea meant to persuade people to buy items.

title: I am afraid of sex
author: speaker
text: I am a female, and I am afraid of having sex. I am afraid of disappointing my partner by being inexperienced. I think he thinks I'm not a virgin. I am also scared that he will be disappointed with my naked body. I don't want my partner to think differently of me because I am afraid of having sex.

title: I am afraid of sex
author: listener
text: The greatest sex experience will be with someone who you feel connected to outside the bed.

title: I am afraid of sex
author: listener
text: This is something that you should feel comfortable in talking with your partner about.

title: I am afraid of sex
author: listener
text: The relationship needs to be strong before moving to the bed anyways.

title: I am afraid of sex
author: listener
text: If the love is there, he will understand your fears and make you feel comfortable making it a great experience.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: speaker
text: I have been dating a guy for two years. I think I love him, but I don't know any more. I am in my late teens, and I have been living with him for most of our relationship. I have been talking to a guy friend, and I feel more loved by him than my boyfriend.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: Hi Michigan, Relationships are so sparkly for a few years, and then things start to feel different.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: Most of the time, this is simply because we've pulled back from all the attachment-forming behaviours we did at the beginning.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: We stop talking a lot, because we have less to discover...we do less for each other and buy fewer gifts...spend less time together...all because we have already formed the love and attachment and we don't need to "fill the gas tank" as much.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: So, just because it feels different doesn't mean it's "gone bad".Having said that, it seems as though you are missing something in this relationship that you need; you don't feel loved enough right now.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: Can you tell him?

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: Have you told him?

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: The strength of your relationship is more clear when people know what the expectations are.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: Let him know what you need, and see if he gets it.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: You have choices to make and there is no wrong choice.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: You certainly have the right to say "this isn't feeling great anymore", or "I want to explore other relationships", and walk away.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: But often it's worth it to see how good something can be before you bail.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: You're drawn to someone else, and this is up to you to decide how this fits with your expectations of yourself in a relationship.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: Your interest in this other guy is sparkly and new.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: Your boyfriend can't compete with that if he doesn't know you're unhappy.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: For some people, being drawn to someone else is a sign they're not into their partner.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: For others, it's a danger alert, and it makes them want to improve their current relationship.

title: I don't know if I should end my relationship or try and stick through it
author: listener
text: Which one are you?

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: speaker
text: He owns his own business. Sometimes, he stays out all night but doesn't tell me. We have a son together, and I get to stay home with him. He says I complain too much about what he's doing. We've been together a year and a half. I got pregnant after being together for a month. We moved in together when I had my son in July. Everything was great, and then he started the staying out. He then started not spending time with either of us. I just don't know if I'm doing something wrong. We've talked and he says this is just how he is, but he wasn't like this before.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: Congrats on the birth of your son!Your situation sounds painful, lonely, and isolating.And, these features are eating away at your self-confidence.Start by believing in yourself.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: The feelings and ideas you describe here would only be arising from within you because they are at the very least, partly true.Ask your boyfriend if he is willing to listen and understand your point of view.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: If he does, then hopefully the two of you will more easily talk with one another about the truth of feeling overwhelmed by the quick pace of your courtship and becoming a family.If these discussions continuously include him blaming you for having your own feelings and expecting him to more actively be a part of your and your son's life, then you'll need to start valuing your feelings and what is best for you and your son, by yourself.I send you lots of good luck!

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: speaker
text: He owns his own business. Sometimes, he stays out all night but doesn't tell me. We have a son together, and I get to stay home with him. He says I complain too much about what he's doing. We've been together a year and a half. I got pregnant after being together for a month. We moved in together when I had my son in July. Everything was great, and then he started the staying out. He then started not spending time with either of us. I just don't know if I'm doing something wrong. We've talked and he says this is just how he is, but he wasn't like this before.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: Hi Oklahoma, Listen to him when he says this is how he is.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: Your boyfriend's behaviours are about him; not you.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: At the start of a relationship it's easy to be loving and attentive; but it takes years to really get to know someone deeply.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: With time, people reveal who they are.For some reason, he is giving himself permission to detach from you and your son.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: This could be for several reasons; he may be avoiding intimacy and connection, he may be avoiding commitment, he may fear he isn't enough, or (and there is evidence of this one) he may have misogynist attitudes about male privilege that interfere with his ability to be the kind of supportive and respectful partner that you need.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: It seems that you've addressed this problem with him and told him what you need.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: Good for you.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: His response seems dismissive though, and this isn't a good sign.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: Any problem can be worked through if you have two people who care about, respect and listen to each other.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: It seems this basic foundation is missing here.I suggest a therapist might be able to help you sort out where to go from here.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener
text: I wish you the best.

title: My boyfriend says he doesn't like to do things with me because we fight too much
author: listener

title: My boyfriend is always accusing me of not loving him
author: speaker
text: I love him so much, and I don't know what to do.

title: My boyfriend is always accusing me of not loving him
author: listener
text: Hi Savannah, This is a pretty common issue; one person feels that they are doing a great job of being loving, yet their partner doesn't feel loved.

title: My boyfriend is always accusing me of not loving him
author: listener
text: There's a great book "The Five Love Languages" by Gary Chapman.

title: My boyfriend is always accusing me of not loving him
author: listener
text: He explains that there are five main ways to give and receive love, but we don't necessarily all speak the same "love language" as our partner.

title: My boyfriend is always accusing me of not loving him
author: listener
text: You might feel that by going out to work and earn money, you're being loving, but if your partner's main love language is quality time, you're not hitting that bulls eye because you're not home!

title: My boyfriend is always accusing me of not loving him
author: listener
text: The five languages are words, quality time, acts of service, gifts and touch.

title: My boyfriend is always accusing me of not loving him
author: listener

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: speaker
text: My fiancé and I have almost the best relationship every girl wants, but lately it's changed. I get less attention and little to no intercourse. He works a lot and goes to the gym a lot (he's a football player for an indoor league), but he has no time for me. We live two hours from family, and when I leave home to see family, he'll text me saying "whatever" and "leave me alone." But when we're together, everything is okay. No fighting or anything. I love this man, but I just don't know what to do anymore.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: Hello, It doesn't feel good when it seems that your partner no longer cares or cares less for you, especially if your feelings have not changed.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: It can be scary, frustrating, and lonely.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: I would suggest to start there.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: There may be several reasons for his actions, some of which may have nothing to do with how he feels for you.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: Learning about what is going on for him will likely answer your questions and, depending on his response, may cause some relief.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: When initiating conversations about subjects that are sensitive, there are a few things that you want to remember.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?

author: listener
text: For example, you may say something such as, "I feel confused that we are rarely intimate and I'm wondering if you've also noticed this change" versus "You are never intimate with me anymore."

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: Don't be afraid to ask him questions.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: You deserve to know what is going on, as his behavior is effecting your well being.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: I like to ask open-ended questions instead of yes and no questions.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: It allows for more clarity and deeper explanation.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?

text: Let him know that you are willing to work things out as a team.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: If communication attempts fail, seeing a couple's therapist can be a great benefit.

title: How can I get my fiancé to notice me again?
author: listener
text: Having an objective party to coach you through this difficut time can give you the support that will create lasting changes in your relationship.Best of luck to you!

title: What should I do if I think my partner is cheating?

title: My partner is bored of being intimate with me
author: speaker
text: My partner and I have had an amazing relationship and connection for over two years. We're very committed to each other and are planning a very long life together. However, he recently was very open and honest that he isn't interested in having sex with me anymore. He says this has happened in every past relationships and has ended it as a result. He knows it's because it's the "same person" feeling, but how can he get over this?

title: My partner is bored of being intimate with me
author: listener
text: I wonder how long "anymore" will be for your boyfriend.Since you both are planning a long life together, instead of his custom of ending relationships when he feels bored with the sex, he will be facing the situation of being in a relationship and not having sex with his partner to whom he is committed.What are your own views on the meaning of sex in a relationship?Knowing this will help you be better able to collaborate with your boyfriend on finding ways of balancing what you each would like.

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex
author: speaker
text: My wife and I have a great relationship except for our sex lives. We are pretty transparent and honest, and basically, she feels bad because she never wants to have sex. She doesn't have the desire. She's also never orgasmed. She feels like a terrible wife and fears I'll cheat on her. She doesn't know why. Last time we had sex, she cried and felt bad and didn't know why she cried. However, she also told me that the last time we had sex, she felt me in her, but it just felt "ehh" and wanted to stop. That makes me feel really awful. We rarely have foreplay. Everything I try tickles her, so she makes me stop. We are both frustrated but very much in love. She and I are in our early 20s. We’re married and we have a baby on the way.

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex
author: listener
text: That sounds really challenging for both of you.

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex
author: listener
text: Differences in sexual desire between partners is common and can create real friction and conflict.

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex
author: listener
text: I would encourage you to do some couples counselling or sex therapy as often these issues can be worked through and low sexual desire can result from relational fears and misunderstandings or sex that isn't as arousing as is possible.

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex
author: listener
text: There are some good videos on this resource page about sexuality and intimacy and a video that specifically addresses desire differences in relationships.

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex
author: listener
text: Congrats on your upcoming baby!Its possible that the pregnancy is diminishing your wife's sex drive.From everything you describe about your wife, she sounds to not yet have become comfortable with having a wish for sex.The other side of the sex equation is you and your relative ease with having sex and whether it is for physical release or as an expression of love, some of each.Since you talk with each other honestly then start with a dialogue about what you each would like from sex with each other, from perspective of giving and receiving sex.

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex

text: Hopefully this will open up some new light on your respective feelings.Really, there is a lot to navigate in a conversation about physical and emotional intimacy.

title: My wife doesn't want to have sex
author: listener
text: If these are not the types of discussions the two of you are used to having, a couples therapist is a good idea so you both become familiar and learn how to more easily articulate some of your respective deep feelings.
